me.tatarka.ipromise

Class Progress<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.tatarka.ipromise.Progress<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the message
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Async<T>, Closeable

    public class Progress<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Async<T>, Closeable
    A progress is a way to return multiple values over time. You cannot construct a progress directly, instead you must get one from a Channel.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int RETAIN_ALL
      Retains all messages.
      static int RETAIN_LAST
      Retains only the last message.
      static int RETAIN_NONE
      Don't retain any messages.

    • Field Detail

      • RETAIN_NONE

        public static final int RETAIN_NONE
        Don't retain any messages. Messages received before a listener is attached will be dropped.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • RETAIN_LAST

        public static final int RETAIN_LAST
        Retains only the last message. When a listener is attached, it will immediately receive the last message sent. This is the default.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • RETAIN_ALL

        public static final int RETAIN_ALL
        Retains all messages. When a listener is attached, it will immediately receive all messages sent up to that point. Be aware of the memory implications of keeping all messages.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Progress

        public Progress(java.lang.Iterable<T> messages)
        Constructs a progress which immediately delivers the given messages. This is useful when you can send the messages immediately.
        Parameters:
        messages - the messages to send

      • Progress

        public Progress(T... messages)
        Constructs a progress which immediately delivers the given messages. This is useful when you can send the messages immediately.
        Parameters:
        messages - the messages to send

    • Method Detail

      • cancelToken

        public CancelToken cancelToken()
        Specified by:
        cancelToken in interface Async<T>

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        Cancels the Progress, notifying all listeners and propagating the cancellation to all Progresses that share the CancelToken. A canceled Progress will ignore all subsequent messages.

      • isCanceled

        public boolean isCanceled()
        Returns if the progress has been canceled.
        Returns:
        true if canceled, false otherwise

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Specified by:
        isRunning in interface Async<T>

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed()
        Specified by:
        isClosed in interface Closeable

      • listen

        public Progress<T> listen(Listener<T> listener)
        Listens to a Progress, receiving messages as they are delivered. Messages are buffered until a Listener is added, so that none are missed. If there was already a listener added, the new listener will replace it and receive only the last result given to the Promise.
        Specified by:
        listen in interface Async<T>
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to call when the progress receives a message
        Returns:
        the progress for chaining

      • onClose

        public Progress<T> onClose(CloseListener listener)
        Listens to a Progress, receiving a callback when the Progress is closed, i.e. it wont receive any more messages. If the Progress is already closed, the callback will be called immediately. If this method is called multiple times, only the latest CloseListener will be called.
        Specified by:
        onClose in interface Closeable
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener
        Returns:
        the progress for chaining

      • then

        public <T2> Progress<T2> then(Map<T,T2> map)
        Constructs a new progress that receives a message when the original progress receives one but passes the result through the given Map function.
        Type Parameters:
        T2 - the type of the new Progress message.
        Parameters:
        map - the function to chain the result of the original Progress to the new progress
        Returns:
        the new Progress

      • then

        public <T2> Progress<T2> then(Chain<T,Progress<T2>> chain)
        Constructs a new Progress that chains two progresses in succession.
        Type Parameters:
        T2 - the type of the second Progress messages
        Parameters:
        chain - the Chain that constructs the second Progress
        Returns:
        the new Progress

        public Progress<T> then(Filter<T> filter)

        public <T2> Progress<T2> then(T2 start,
                              Fold<T,T2> fold)

        public Progress<T> then(Fold<T,T> fold)

      • batch

        public Progress<java.util.List<T>> batch(int size)

      • cast

        public <T2> Progress<T2> cast()
        Forces a cast of a progress to a super-type to get around covariance restrictions. T2 must be a superclass of T. This is safe because you can't directly deliver messages to the cast progress.
        Type Parameters:
        T2 - the type of the message to cast to
        Returns:
        a cast of the progress
